headline: Unveiling Bitcoin RSI: Why PlanB‚Äôs Astute Analysis Calms Crypto Market Fears
summary: BitcoinWorld Unveiling Bitcoin RSI: Why PlanB‚Äôs Astute Analysis Calms Crypto Market Fears Are you feeling a slight tremor of concern as Bitcoin‚Äôs Relative Strength Index (RSI) climbs? For many traditional investors, an RSI hitting 70 often signals an ‚Äòoverbought‚Äô asset, typically followed by a price correction. But what if the rules for the volatile and exciting crypto market are different? Renowned analyst PlanB, famous for his Stock-to-Flow model, recently took to X to share a crucial perspective that might just put those worries to rest. Understanding Bitcoin RSI: Is 70 Really Overbought? The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is a momentum oscillator that measures the speed and change of price movements. It oscillates between 0 and 100. Traditionally, an RSI reading above 70 suggests an asset is overbought, while a reading below 30 indicates it‚Äôs oversold. These are often seen as signals for potential reversals. However, PlanB‚Äôs latest insight challenges this conventional wisdom when applied to Bitcoin. He pointed out that while a 70 RSI might raise eyebrows in traditional finance, it‚Äôs quite a normal occurrence for Bitcoin. Why? Because Bitcoin typically operates within a much broader RSI range, historically trading between 40 and 90. This makes the current level of 70 only slightly above its historical average of 65. This critical piece of PlanB analysis suggests that applying traditional metrics without considering Bitcoin‚Äôs unique market dynamics can lead to misinterpretations. Why Does Bitcoin Behave Differently? Exploring Unique Market Dynamics Bitcoin isn‚Äôt your average stock or commodity. Its inherent volatility, driven by factors like halving events, global macroeconomic shifts, rapid technological adoption, and evolving regulatory landscapes, contributes to its distinct RSI behavior. Here are a few reasons why Bitcoin‚Äôs RSI might differ: Rapid Price Discovery: Bitcoin is still a relatively young asset class, undergoing rapid price discovery. Periods of intense buying pressure can sustain high RSI levels for longer than traditional assets. Halving Cycles: Bitcoin‚Äôs programmatic supply shock events (halvings) often precede parabolic bull runs, during which the asset can appear ‚Äòoverbought‚Äô for extended periods as demand outstrips supply. Global Accessibility: Unlike many traditional markets, Bitcoin trades 24/7 globally, leading to continuous price action that can sustain momentum. Investor Psychology: The unique blend of retail and institutional investor sentiment in crypto can lead to prolonged buying frenzies that defy traditional ‚Äòoverbought‚Äô indicators. Navigating the Market: Actionable Insights for Bitcoin Investors So, what does this mean for you, the everyday Bitcoin investor? It means looking beyond simplistic indicators and understanding the broader context. Here are some actionable insights: Context is King: Don‚Äôt just look at the RSI number; understand where Bitcoin is in its market cycle (e.g., pre-halving, post-halving, accumulation phase). Long-Term Perspective: Bitcoin‚Äôs historical performance shows that even after periods of high RSI, significant upside has often followed. A long-term holding strategy often outperforms short-term trading based on single indicators. Diversify Your Analysis: While RSI is a valuable tool, combine it with other indicators like moving averages, volume trends, and on-chain metrics to get a more comprehensive picture. Avoid Panic Selling: The fear of an ‚Äòoverbought‚Äô asset can lead to premature selling. PlanB‚Äôs perspective helps mitigate this fear by contextualizing the current RSI level. Challenging the ‚ÄòOverbought Bitcoin‚Äô Narrative The idea of an overbought Bitcoin at an RSI of 70 is largely a narrative carried over from traditional markets. In equity markets, an RSI of 70 often suggests that a stock‚Äôs price has risen too quickly and is due for a pullback. However, Bitcoin‚Äôs parabolic growth phases have frequently seen its RSI sustain levels well into the 80s and even 90s before any significant correction. This resilience to traditional ‚Äòoverbought‚Äô signals is a hallmark of Bitcoin‚Äôs unique market behavior and highlights the importance of crypto-specific analysis. PlanB‚Äôs consistent focus on Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term value and unique market dynamics provides a calming perspective amidst short-term market fluctuations. His emphasis on the historical trading range of 40-90 for Bitcoin‚Äôs RSI reminds us that what might seem alarming in one market is perfectly normal in another. This understanding empowers investors to make more informed decisions, reducing the likelihood of reacting to false signals and staying focused on the asset‚Äôs potential. The Future of Investor Sentiment in the Crypto Market As the crypto market matures, the sophistication of its analysis must evolve. Relying solely on traditional indicators can be misleading. PlanB‚Äôs latest commentary serves as a powerful reminder that Bitcoin operates under its own rules, influenced by unique supply-demand dynamics, technological advancements, and a passionate global community. Understanding these nuances is key to navigating the exciting yet volatile world of digital assets. By embracing a crypto-native analytical approach, investors can better gauge true market health and make decisions aligned with Bitcoin‚Äôs unique trajectory. summary: BitcoinWorld US Stock Markets Soar: What This Positive Open Means for Crypto The financial world is buzzing today as US stock markets opened with a noticeable upward momentum, a development that often sends ripples across various investment sectors, including the dynamic realm of cryptocurrencies. As the S&P 500, NASDAQ, and Dow Jones Industrial Average all registered positive gains, investors are keenly observing what this bullish start signifies for broader investor sentiment and, crucially, its potential implications for digital assets. For many in the crypto community, understanding the interplay between traditional finance and the decentralized world is key to navigating market volatility and identifying emerging opportunities. Let‚Äôs delve into the specifics of today‚Äôs market open and explore its wider economic ramifications. What‚Äôs Driving the US Stock Markets Rally Today? Today‚Äôs trading session commenced on a high note, with all major US stock markets indices showing promising gains right from the opening bell. The S&P 500, a benchmark for large-cap U.S. equities, climbed by +0.37%. Meanwhile, the tech-heavy NASDAQ Composite, often a barometer for growth stocks and innovation, saw a respectable rise of +0.31%. Not to be outdone, the venerable Dow Jones Industrial Average, representing 30 significant American companies, posted a gain of +0.28%. These figures, while modest, paint a picture of renewed confidence and positive buying pressure. This upward movement suggests a prevailing optimism among investors, perhaps fueled by recent corporate earnings reports, economic data, or shifting macroeconomic expectations. Such an immediate positive reaction at the market open often sets the tone for the rest of the trading day and can indicate a broader shift in market psychology. Decoding Investor Sentiment: Why Does a Strong Open Matter? A strong market open , particularly across major indices, is more than just numbers; it‚Äôs a powerful indicator of prevailing investor sentiment . When markets open higher, it often reflects a collective belief among participants that economic conditions are favorable, corporate profits will continue to grow, or that anticipated challenges are manageable. This positive outlook can create a virtuous cycle, encouraging more investment and further bolstering asset prices. Conversely, a weak opening can signal apprehension or a lack of confidence. For cryptocurrency enthusiasts, tracking traditional market sentiment is vital because, despite their distinct characteristics, crypto markets often mirror the risk appetite seen in equities. When traditional investors feel confident enough to buy stocks, they might also be more inclined to allocate capital to higher-risk assets like Bitcoin and Ethereum, perceiving the broader economic outlook as stable enough to support such ventures. This interconnectedness highlights the importance of keeping an eye on the bigger financial picture. The Crypto Correlation Conundrum: How Connected Are We? The relationship between US stock markets and the cryptocurrency space has been a subject of intense debate. Historically, Bitcoin, often seen as ‚Äúdigital gold,‚Äù was thought to be an uncorrelated asset, acting as a hedge against traditional market volatility. However, recent years have shown an increasing crypto correlation with major equity indices, particularly the NASDAQ. When tech stocks rally, often so do cryptocurrencies, and vice versa. Today‚Äôs positive stock market opening could, therefore, be interpreted as a bullish signal for crypto. Why this correlation? As institutional adoption of crypto grows and more traditional investors enter the space, digital assets are increasingly treated as risk-on assets, much like growth stocks. This means that factors influencing traditional equities‚Äîsuch as interest rates, inflation, and global economic stability‚Äîcan also impact crypto prices. While the correlation isn‚Äôt always perfect, a robust performance in traditional markets often creates a favorable environment for crypto, signaling a broader willingness to take on risk across the investment landscape. It‚Äôs a reminder that while crypto offers unique value propositions, it doesn‚Äôt operate in a vacuum. Navigating the Economic Outlook: What‚Äôs Next for Markets and Crypto? Today‚Äôs positive market open certainly paints an encouraging picture for the immediate future, but what does it mean for the broader economic outlook and its long-term implications for both traditional finance and cryptocurrencies? A sustained upward trend in stock markets typically suggests underlying economic strength, perhaps driven by strong employment figures, contained inflation, or a dovish stance from central banks. For crypto, this can translate into continued investor confidence and potentially higher capital inflows. However, investors must remain vigilant. The global economy is a complex web, influenced by geopolitical events, regulatory shifts, and technological advancements. While a positive start is welcome, factors like persistent inflation, potential interest rate hikes, or unexpected global events could quickly shift the narrative. Therefore, while today‚Äôs gains are a reason for optimism, a prudent approach involves closely monitoring upcoming economic data, central bank announcements, and significant news events. Understanding these broader macroeconomic forces is crucial for making informed decisions, whether you‚Äôre trading stocks or digital assets, as they all contribute to the overarching investor sentiment . Actionable Insights for the Savvy Investor: Monitor Macro Trends: Don‚Äôt just watch crypto charts. Keep an eye on traditional market performance, inflation data, and interest rate announcements. They significantly influence risk appetite. Diversify Wisely: While correlations exist, maintaining a diversified portfolio across different asset classes (including a mix of traditional and digital assets) can help mitigate risks. Stay Informed: News from major economies, particularly the US, can directly impact global market sentiment. Being aware of these developments helps in anticipating market shifts. Assess Risk Appetite: A rising tide lifts all boats, but be prepared for potential pullbacks. Understand your own risk tolerance before making significant investment decisions. In conclusion, today‚Äôs strong market open in US stock markets provides a significant boost to overall investor sentiment , reflecting a generally positive economic outlook . While not a direct predictor, this upward trajectory often fosters a more favorable environment for the cryptocurrency market, highlighting the growing crypto correlation . As traditional and digital financial worlds become increasingly intertwined, understanding these connections is paramount for any investor seeking to navigate the complex yet opportunity-rich landscape. The current positive momentum serves as a reminder that the broader financial ecosystem plays a crucial role in shaping the future of digital assets. headline: Bakkt files for SEC shelf registration amid the growing interest in crypto
summary: The publicly traded crypto custody and loyalty rewards firm Bakkt plans to raise $1 billion in an equity and debt offering to support a ‚ÄúBitcoin strategy‚Äù. This is according to filings submitte d to the US Securities and Exchange Commission on Thursday, June 26. The shelf offering could consist of sales of Bakkt‚Äôs Class A common stock, preferred stock, warrants, and debt securities. The shift would be the latest strategic change for Bakkt. However, according to the SEC filing , the firm has not yet made any crypto purchases. Bakkt files for SEC shelf registration amid the growing interest in crypto Bakkt submitted a filing to the SEC through a ‚Äúshelf‚Äù registration process. With this shelf registration, the firm can occasionally sell any mix of the securities mentioned in the prospectus in one or more offerings. The filing stated that Bakkt may sell securities occasionally through one or more offerings, with amounts, prices, and terms decided at the time of each offering. This prospectus outlined the basic terms of these securities and how the firm will offer them. According to the filing, the total price for the securities Bakkt sells will not go over $1 billion. The SEC also required the company to include the price they would pay for those securities and the amount of money they expected to make from the sale. This came after Bakkt said it had ‚Äúupdated‚Äù the investment policy to specifically allocate capital into Bitcoin and other digital assets as part of its treasury and corporate strategy on June 10. Founded in 2018, Bakkt is now an emerging crypto treasury firm that allows investors to make a leveraged bet on digital assets such as Bitcoin, ETH, and SOL by financing digital asset purchases in the traditional capital markets. Earlier, the Atlanta-based firm, which started with backing from the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) owner Intercontinental Exchange, offered an institutional-grade trading platform for daily physically-settled Bitcoin futures before trying to tokenize rewards points and crypto custody. This product failed to gain traction. The company went public in 2021. Meanwhile, Bakkt‚Äôs initial Chief Executive Officer, Kelly Loeffler, resigned in 2019 to briefly serve as a Republican United States senator in Georgia under the first Trump administration . Moreover, President Donald Trump‚Äôs social media company, Truth Social, was said to be in ‚Äúadvanced talks‚Äù to acquire Bakkt last November. Bakkt officials highlight the firm‚Äôs focus on crypto Following the announcement that Bakkt had ‚Äúupdated‚Äù the investment policy, Akshay Naheta, co-CEO of Bakkt, stated that this plan aims to help Bakkt change into a company that focuses solely on crypto infrastructure and allows them to add Bitcoin and other digital assets to their treasury carefully. According to Naheta‚Äôs speculations, their strategy shows their strong belief in the future of digital assets and their goal for Bakkt to grow globally and become a leader in programmable money. Andy Main, Co-CEO and President of Bakkt, also commented on the topic of discussion. According to him, their updated investment policy shows their confidence in digital assets‚Äô long-term potential and dedication to seeking strategic opportunities that increase shareholder value. Main said this is a significant step for the company as it looks to expand into global payments and remittance systems using stablecoins while being part of the ongoing development of the digital asset ecosystem. Government Spending Adjustments: Changes in federal, state, and local government expenditures can also impact GDP. A reduction in government projects or aid could contribute to a slowdown. Net Exports Fluctuation: The balance between exports and imports plays a role. If imports significantly outpace exports, it creates a drag on GDP. Global economic slowdowns can impact demand for U.S. goods. Inventory Adjustments: Businesses might be reducing their inventories, which can temporarily reduce GDP even if final sales remain stable. headline: US stock futures open with a new all-time high as Bitcoin stumbles
summary: Stock futures in the United States opened Thursday night flat, but the S&P 500 still managed to press its face against a fresh record, leaving investors glued to the screen as they wait for the official inflation numbers due Friday morning. This comes as the index climbed 0.8% during the day, ending the session at 6,141.02, just inches away from the 6,147.43 intraday record last hit in February. The Dow Jones added 0.9%, while the Nasdaq Composite moved up nearly 1%, also heading toward a potential all-time high of its own. Futures tied to the Dow Jones Industrial Average added just 33 points in after-hours trading, a 0.1% lift. Meanwhile, Nasdaq 100 and S&P 500 futures stayed mostly unchanged. This cautious positioning comes ahead of key inflation data that will either keep the rally going or yank it off course. Investors wait for new inflation data According to CNBC, Rick Rieder, who heads global fixed income at BlackRock, said, ‚ÄúThere is so much money that wants to come into the market that didn‚Äôt for a while. And I just think if you don‚Äôt have any negative news, the natural gravitational pull is across all these assets.‚Äù On Friday, traders are set to dig into May‚Äôs personal consumption expenditures price index. It‚Äôs a big deal‚Äîthis is the Fed‚Äôs preferred inflation measure. Economists polled by Dow Jones expect a monthly increase of 0.1%, and a year-over-year jump of 2.3%. The core PCE, which takes out food and energy, is also forecasted to rise 0.1% for the month and 2.6% for the year. That‚Äôs not all investors are watching. The morning will also bring updates on consumer spending, personal income, and consumer sentiment. The results could decide if the recent rally continues or runs out of steam. Despite the Fed still dancing around its rate strategy and ongoing geopolitical pressure, the stock market has clawed its way back from its lows earlier this year. All three major indexes have posted solid weekly gains: the S&P 500 and Dow are up over 2%, and the Nasdaq has jumped more than 3%. Bitcoin trapped in tight range as whales unload While equities flirt with records, Bitcoin is stuck pacing the same ten-foot circle it‚Äôs been walking since May 9. The price has mostly bounced between $102,000 and $112,000, with just one brief spike beyond that ceiling to hit a new high, still barely ahead of its last one. It hasn‚Äôt managed a strong rally, despite an insane amount of interest from institutions. Just this Wednesday, Bitcoin ETFs recorded their 12th straight day of inflows and are now heading toward their ninth positive week in eleven, pulling in $3.5 billion just this month, according to Coin Metrics. Yet Bitcoin itself has only risen by 2%. Markus Thielen, who leads 10x Research, explained why. ‚ÄúWe are not seeing a lot of real demand right now because the demand has been almost perfectly offset by the selling from these larger wallets,‚Äù he said. Markus called it an ‚Äúorderly‚Äù change of ownership, where old megawhales are taking their time to sell off coins to new buyers like ETFs and corporate treasuries. The wallets that are buying the most this year? Those holding between 100 and 1,000 BTC. CryptoQuant classifies these holders as dolphins, and Julio Moreno, the firm‚Äôs head of research, says that many ETFs probably fall into this group. Whales and miners control the game The biggest players in crypto right now are still whales (wallets holding 1,000 to 10,000 BTC) and megawhales (10,000+ BTC). But they‚Äôre not buying. They‚Äôve been net sellers since the start of the year. Retail wallets, those holding less than one full bitcoin, are also dumping. It‚Äôs the dolphins who are stepping in to soak up that pressure. But that balance is fragile. Julio said that companies like BlackRock and Strategy (the company formerly known as MicroStrategy) have built large positions using hundreds of wallets. BlackRock holds around 550 wallets, each averaging 1,290 BTC. Strategy controls about 490 wallets, with an average of 927 BTC per wallet. But even with these holdings spread out, they‚Äôre considered large buyers behind most of the recent ETF flows. Despite all the buying, price movement has stayed muted. That‚Äôs because some of the biggest bitcoin reserves on the planet are still in the hands of Chinese miners. Between 2013 and 2021, China controlled up to 75% of the global hashrate. Out of the 19.9 million bitcoins mined so far, between 11 and 15 million came from China-based miners. Of that, about 5 million are still under their control, according to Markus. Normally, during a big price rally, these wallets start dumping on exchanges. This time, they haven‚Äôt. ‚ÄúIt seems that these wallets are holding ‚Äì holding tight and only releasing as many bitcoin as can be scooped up by ETFs and by Strategy,‚Äù Markus said . Strategy, now focused on corporate crypto adoption, has slowed down its BTC buying this year. That‚Äôs mostly because its stock premium has narrowed, and competition from other treasury buyers is rising fast. Markus warned that ‚Äúif megawhale selling accelerates further, a deeper correction is likely.‚Äù On the other hand, if those big sellers back off and whale accumulation starts to rise, the next leg up might finally begin. headline: Wall Street sees stablecoins as trillion-dollar shortcut to kill banks and dominate payments
summary: Wall Street is quietly betting big on stablecoins, not as a crypto side hustle but as a full-blown replacement for bank wires and card networks. Today, Circle, which went public on the New York Stock Exchange earlier this month, saw its shares jump almost 8%, recovering from a brief dip. The stock has now surged over 600% since its IPO. That price action is coming at a time when big financial firms are laying new tracks to run global payments through stablecoins instead of traditional banks. The excitement around Circle didn‚Äôt happen in a vacuum. Bitcoin and ether have both been climbing this week, pushed higher by hopes of lower interest rates, a calmer stance from President Trump‚Äôs White House on tariffs, and a temporary breather in Middle East conflicts. But for investors chasing Circle and the stablecoin market, it‚Äôs not just about riding the crypto wave. It‚Äôs about ripping out the old money pipes and laying down a whole new system. Fiserv and Mastercard start connecting stablecoins to payments rails According to CNBC, Fiserv, a payments company with deep ties in banking, released a stablecoin earlier this week. Almost immediately after, Mastercard linked that coin into its existing payments network. It‚Äôs one of the clearest signs yet that old-school finance is loading up the backend for what they see as a trillion-dollar opportunity. Zach Abrams, the co-founder and CEO of Bridge, told CNBC‚Äôs MacKenzie Sigalos on Thursday‚Äôs ‚ÄúCrypto World‚Äù that stablecoins could grow into the trillions, calling them ‚Äúan entirely new money-movement platform, like credit cards were decades ago.‚Äù He added, ‚ÄúCredit cards created trillions in value, and I think stablecoins will be the same.‚Äù Abrams says this transformation will unfold over years, not months, but it‚Äôs already happening behind the curtain. His company, Bridge, which just got bought by Stripe in a $1.1 billion deal, is already powering real transactions. ScaleAI, which recently received a $14 billion investment from Meta, uses Bridge to pay its global network of data labelers. SpaceX is also using Bridge to collect payments from Starlink customers in local currencies and convert them back to U.S. dollars. These are real-use cases, not test pilots. Traditional banks want in before the trillions show up Today, the $400 billion stablecoin market is controlled mostly by Tether and Circle, but that‚Äôs not the ceiling. Abrams said most major banks expect the market to reach a few trillion. That‚Äôs why he believes traditional players like JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, and Fiserv will need to take a piece of the traffic. ‚ÄúIt won‚Äôt get to a few trillion without a huge percentage being handled by traditional financial institutions,‚Äù Abrams said. What this means is clear: the banks that helped build the old system are now racing to rewire it before it‚Äôs fully out of their hands. And the tools they‚Äôre using are stablecoins, not wires, not ACH, not SWIFT. Meanwhile, Wall Street‚Äôs push into tokenization keeps expanding. Republic, an investment startup based in New York, announced this week that it will let users buy digital tokens representing shares in private companies like SpaceX, OpenAI, and Anthropic. The price of entry? Just $50. That‚Äôs a massive drop from the usual $10,000 minimum required for investing in these kinds of deals. It‚Äôs the kind of retail-access play that shows how far tokenization has already gone, and how much more Wall Street thinks it can extract from packaging real-world assets into tradable tokens.
